intro: Syngonanthus crassinervius var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-veined mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on a variety of host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are usually red or orange, containing seeds that are dispersed by birds. This species is native to parts of South America and is often found in humid, tropical forests.
